title: Construction & Demolition Waste Mandates: Cross-Sectoral Systems Map
description: 30% recycled aggregate quota in public procurement + demolition plans

nodes.label: Waste
nodes.description: C&D Waste: 30% recycled aggregate quota + demolition plans

links.quantification: Demolition plans → 70% material recovery (vs. 10% dump-and-build) → 150 MT/year C&D waste diverted → circular construction
30% recycled aggregate quota → ₹15K Cr public works demand → market pull for C&D recycling → infrastructure sustainability
Mandate creates market → ₹10K Cr C&D recycling sector investment → 100 processing plants → 500K jobs created
Virgin aggregate demand -30% → mining footprint reduction → 20K ha quarry land spared → ecosystem preservation
Demolition cost increase: Selective dismantling 40% slower/costlier vs. bulldozing → developer resistance → policy dilution pressure
Quality perception barrier: Engineers resist recycled aggregate → strength concerns → BIS standards clarification + 5-year acceptance period
Recycling → less demolition dust + quarrying emissions → PM2.5 reduction → health improves → compliance support grows (reinforcing)
Requires design for deconstruction: Recovery only viable with modular building codes → structural engineering reforms prerequisite
Via cost reduction: Recycled aggregate 20% cheaper (at scale) → municipal infrastructure budgets stretch 15% further
Via mining reduction: Quarry blasting emissions -30% → local air quality improves → respiratory health benefits in mining zones
